articles.author: Eduardo Baptista, Hyunsu Yim, Joyce Lee
articles.description: Authorities were en route on Friday to execute an arrest warrant for impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol, Yonhap News Agency reported, as a crowd of protesters faced off with police outside his residence and vowed to block any attempt.
articles.title: South Korea authorities moving to arrest impeached President Yoon, Yonhap says

articles.author: Brian Thevenot
articles.description: Investigators in New Orleans were searching for what motivated a U.S. Army veteran flying an ISIS flag from his truck to plow into a crowd of New Year's revelers, killing 15 people and injuring 30 more before dying in a shootout with police.
articles.title: Police probe motive in New Orleans truck rampage

articles.author: Hyunsu Yim, Eduardo Baptista, Minwoo Park
articles.description: Supporters of impeached South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol are adopting "Stop the Steal" slogans popularised by U.S. President-elect Donald Trump supporters and said they hoped the incoming president would help their embattled leader.
articles.title: Supporters of South Korea's Yoon adopt 'Stop the Steal', hope Trump will help

articles.author: Hyunjoo Jin
articles.description: South Korea's transport ministry has extended by a week special inspections of all 101 of the Boeing 737-800 jets run by the country's airlines, as jet engine maker GE joined a probe into the deadliest aviation disaster on the country's soil.
articles.title: South Korea extends Boeing 737-800 inspections following fatal crash

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A fire and thick smoke engulfed an eight-story building in the South Korean city of Seongnam on Friday, sending 12 people to hospital with smoke inhalation, and about 30 people who had been trapped were safely rescued, the fire department said.
articles.title: Dozens rescued in South Korea building fire, emergency department says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three Virgin Australia IPO-VIR.AX staff are not being detained by Fijian police investigating an alleged sexual assault and theft during a layover, said the Fiji government, but added they had been advised by their headquarters to stay in their hotel.
articles.title: Virgin Australia staff not detained in Fiji after theft, sexual assault complaint, says government

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched a barrage of drones in an overnight attack on Ukraine on Friday, killing one civilian and injuring four others in the Kyiv region, the military and regional officials said.
articles.title: Russia launches new barrage of drones at Ukraine, kills one, Kyiv says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Poland decided not to invite Hungary's ambassador to an event on Friday launching Warsaw's EU presidency after Budapest gave asylum to a former deputy minister who is under investigation over alleged misuse of public funds, a senior official said.
articles.title: Poland says Hungarian envoy not welcome at event at start of EU presidency

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: The FBI on Thursday released new surveillance video in a bid to reinvigorate its four-year-old hunt for a suspect who placed pipe bombs in Washington the night before the Jan. 6, 2021, assault on the U.S. Capitol.
articles.title: FBI seeks new leads on Washington suspect in Jan. 6, 2021, pipe bombs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli airstrike killed at least 10 Palestinians in a tent encampment sheltering displaced families in southern Gaza strip early on Thursday, medics said.
articles.title: Israeli airstrike kills at least 10 in southern Gaza, medics say
